Basic details: Emily Carter, a 32-year-old woman, comes to the clinic with a positive pregnancy test.
Vitals:
BP: 110/70 mm Hg
Temp: 98.4°F (36.9°C)
RR: 18/minute
HR: 78/minute, regular
Physical presentation:
Sit calmly in the chair, occasionally touching your abdomen.
Express mild surprise and curiosity about the pregnancy.
If ultrasound is mentioned by the examinee, ask, “What will the ultrasound show?”
Challenging question: "Is it safe for me to continue my medication now that I'm pregnant?"
